Mentoring can mitigate the risk of business failure. Which of the following definitions of Mentorship do you agree with most?
options: Mentoring focuses on relationship-based guidance, rooted in experience, by questioning, challenging, and encouraging the mentee. Mentoring develops skills, knowledge, and/or networks to enhance mentees’ personal and/or professional growth ~ 2
Mentoring describes the guidance provided by a mentor, especially an experienced person in a company or educational institution. ~1
Mentoring teaches specific knowledge training for an entrepreneur to boost his/her business ~0

Mentoring matches an experienced business consultant with an entrepreneur. The entrepreneur has to listen and gets a business consultancy from the Mentor who will write a business plan and work to achieve it under the Mentor’s supervision & decision-making. ~0

In a mentoring practise, a mentee, who is a self-reflective, growth-oriented individual will be matched with a mentor, who shares succsess and failure and gives support for free to achieve the mentee’s intrinsic goal.~2

Mentorship is a dynamic and collaborative relationship between an experienced, knowledgeable individual (the mentor) and a less-experienced individual or team (the mentee) with a shared goal of fostering and accelerating creative thinking, problem-solving, and the development of novel ideas, products, or processes. ~2

Mentorship is a collaborative relationship between a seasoned, knowledgeable individual (the mentor) and an entrepreneur (the mentee) aimed at fostering sustainable & green growth, productivity, and resilience. The mentor provides guidance, expertise, and support tailored to the unique challenges and opportunities faced by SMEs, including aspects such as production and harvest techniques, market access, value chain integration, financial management, and innovation adoption. ~2
